subject: Mental Health
title: Mourning Rituals Around the World
description: One-minute skill: Mourning Rituals Around the World.

hook.text: Jewish shiva, Irish wakes, Tibetan sky burials â€” every culture grieves differently.

buildup.text: Shiva provides structured community support for seven days after a Jewish funeral.

discovery.text: Irish wakes celebrate the person's life with stories, laughter, and communal gathering.

twist.text: All effective mourning rituals share common elements: community, ritual, and expression of emotion.

climax.text: Cultures without strong mourning rituals have higher rates of complicated grief.

punchline.text: The ritual changes. The human need to grieve together doesn't.

quiz.question: What do all effective mourning rituals have in common?
options: Community, ritual structure, and emotional expression
They all last exactly one day
They avoid talking about the deceased
